title: Was life better without technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology has always been a part of humanity and is older than humanity. When people invented fire and clothing, humans were using technology. Prior to that, human-ancestor-beings were using spears and other stone-flake tools: these deserve the name `technology’ as much as any modern computer does. I think then, that you are asking was life better prior to 3.3 million years ago? because it is only prior to this time that technology was absent. The big problem then is that these pre-humans were not the same species even as we humans are today. This means that there is no time in the history of homo sapiens that there was no technology. This web-page shows this timing: Homo sapiens - Wikipedia Technology has always been a part of humanity and is older than it. And before you dismiss me for being petty and pedantic, the above implies that I need to ask ‘which technology in particular are you asking about?’ because basic agriculture, horse-drawn carts, aqueducts and sewers are all very ancient, very much life-changing technology, and our modern society only exists because these existed when they did. Because technology is a continuum, it needs to be viewed as a gradually growing item, so it is not possible to put down a finger in human history and say ‘before this, there is no technology’. Did you perhaps want to choose a particular kind of technology, say computers, and ask was life better before that? I can give this much of an answer: I think that life before humans had local anaesthetics was very often very agonizing and I am pleased that I live in a time when this is available. (It is a tragedy that some humans still do not have access to this technology.) I am suggesting that your question needs a little work on it before you can get a useful answer.
